poem:
### The Weight of Age

In the echo of voices,
a man, seventy-one,
twists his cap,
machine oil under nails,
he has seen the grip weaken,
metal hands fail.
Not the years,
but the moment,
not the shell,
but the wear.
The glint in Biden's eye,
now a cloud, 
the machinery of hope
with too much rust.
